message.content:
{"id": "13725", 
"title": "Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor", 
"description": "When performing the steps to reopen a file in the Java editor and selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, the time it takes to replace the contents of the window with the original is 15 seconds. This seems odd, since reverting the file contents should not take more time than simply closing and reopening the file.", 
"OB": "When answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and double clicking on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the contents of the window are replaced with the original almost instantly. However, when repeating the steps and selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.", 
"EB": "Reverting the file contents should not take more time than closing and reopening the file.", 
"SR": "1. Open a file in the Java editor. \n2. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog. \n3. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. \n4. Repeat steps 1-3. \n5. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor. \n6. Observe the time it takes to replace the contents of the window with the original."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
In your bug reports, it is essential to provide clear and informative statements for the following categories:
- **Observed Behavior (OB):** This section should describe the relevant software behavior, actions, output, or results. Avoid vague statements like "the system does not work."
- **Expected Behavior (EB):** This part should articulate what the software should or is expected to do, using phrases like "should...", "expect...", or "hope...". Avoid suggestions or recommendations for bug resolution in this section.
- **Steps to Reproduce (SR):** Include user actions or operations that can potentially lead to reproducing the issue. Use phrases like "to reproduce," "steps to reproduce," or "follow these steps."
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections. In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements. Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '13725', 'title': 'Bug 13725Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.', 'description': 'Bug 13725Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor. ', 'OB': 'answer "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select "Revert" from the pop upmenu in the editor it takes15 seconds to replace the contents of the windowwith the original. ', 'EB': 'This seems odd, since reverting the file contents ought notto be more than closing and reopening the file. ', 'SR': ''}
